sayyes.title: SayYes
sayyes.description: Full-stack portfolio/agency web application with custom CMS, modular landing page builder, and complete back-office.
sayyes.longDescription: SayYes is a full-stack portfolio/agency website with a custom content management system (CMS). It allows presenting client projects through a dynamic gallery with category filtering, scroll animations, and rich detail views. The application includes a modular landing page builder with 7 different block types, a complete admin back-office with secure authentication, and an on-the-fly image optimization system with dual-layer caching.
features: Design provided by client (digital communication agency)
Dynamic portfolio gallery with real-time filtering
Landing page builder with 7 modular blocks
Configurable Bento grid with 6 different formats

design.title: Client Design
design.content: The design was provided by SayYes Agency, a digital communication agency. My role was to transform their creative vision into a performant and functional web application, faithfully respecting the mockups and brand identity.

overview.title: Overview
overview.content:
SayYes is a full-stack web application for presenting client projects and creating custom marketing landing pages. Built with Remix and React, it delivers a smooth user experience through Framer Motion animations and Lenis smooth scrolling.

The modern architecture combines TypeScript for code robustness, Prisma ORM for data management, and an optimized caching system for maximum performance.

portfolio.title: Portfolio Gallery
portfolio.content: The portfolio gallery features a responsive grid display (2-4 columns) with real-time category filtering. Each project has a detailed view including a hero image with parallax effect, client testimonial, deliverables list, Bento grid for photos, and a carousel of similar projects.

landingBuilder.title: Landing Page Builder
landingBuilder.content: The modular block system allows creating custom landing pages with 7 component types: blocIntro (hero), cards (products/services), chiffresCles (animated metrics), testimonial (client reviews), methods (process steps), faq (accordion), and useCase (portfolio showcase).

backoffice.title: Admin Back-Office
backoffice.content: The complete back-office offers secure session authentication, full CRUD for portfolios, image upload with preview, and a visual landing page builder. SEO management includes meta tags and Schema.org JSON-LD for optimal search engine visibility.

bentoGrid.title: Bento Grid
bentoGrid.content: The Bento grid editor allows configuring image layouts for each project with 6 different formats. The drag & drop interface makes it easy to visually organize content and create unique, engaging presentations.

performance.title: Performance Optimizations
performance.content: The dual-layer image caching system combines memory cache (1h TTL) and disk cache (7 days TTL). Responsive images are generated on demand from 20px to 1920px with automatic format detection (WebP/AVIF with JPEG fallback). Code splitting optimizes loading of heavy assets.

technical.title: Technical Architecture
technical.content: Frontend stack: Remix 2.14, React 18, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Framer Motion, Three.js, and Lenis for smooth scrolling. Backend: Prisma ORM with SQLite, Sharp for image optimization. DevOps: Vite with PWA support, ESLint + Prettier, Service Worker for offline caching.

architecture.title: Full-Stack Architecture
architecture.content: The architecture relies on three distinct layers: Client (React 18 with SSR/Hydration, TypeScript, Framer Motion, Three.js, Tailwind CSS), Remix 2.14 Server (Loaders/Actions, Session Auth, Sharp Image Pipeline), and Data Layer (Prisma ORM, SQLite, dual-layer cache system with Memory Cache 1h TTL and Disk Cache 7 days). This architecture ensures optimal performance (Lighthouse 95+) while maintaining excellent DX with Vite, ESLint, and Hot Module Replacement.

pulseAnalytics.title: Pulse Analytics
pulseAnalytics.description: Enterprise-grade real-time analytics platform processing millions of data points per second with stunning visualizations and actionable insights.
pulseAnalytics.longDescription: Pulse Analytics is a next-generation B2B SaaS platform that transforms raw data into actionable business intelligence. Built to handle massive data streams in real-time, the platform processes over 10,000 events per second with 99.99% uptime. Features include customizable dashboards, AI-driven anomaly detection, automated reporting, and seamless integrations with 50+ third-party services. Currently serving 120+ enterprise clients worldwide.

tchee.title: Tchee
tchee.description: Complete VTC/Taxi application for the African market with real-time GPS tracking, multi-provider payments and driver document verification.
tchee.longDescription: Tchee is a ride-hailing application (Uber/Bolt style) designed specifically for the African market. It connects passengers looking to travel with professional drivers.
features: Real-time GPS tracking of driver on map
Real-time price and trip time estimation
3 payment methods: Cash, Stripe, Mobile Money
Address search with Google Places autocomplete
Dynamic pricing with peak hour surcharges

overview.title: Overview
overview.content:
Tchee is a complete ride-hailing solution developed to meet the specific needs of the African market, and more specifically the Malian market. In Mali, most transactions are done via mobile money.

The idea of the application is to connect passengers and professional drivers through a smooth and intuitive mobile experience, allowing payment via any payment method. It is available in Mali on iOS and Android.

mobileApp.title: Mobile Application
mobileApp.content: A single application for passengers and drivers. Passengers can book a ride in seconds thanks to Google Places autocomplete. Drivers have a dedicated interface with document verification (license, insurance, criminal record). Each profile is validated by administration before activation.

tracking.title: Real-Time GPS Tracking
tracking.content: The core of the application relies on an accurate GPS tracking system. Passengers can follow their driver's arrival on the map, then track the journey to their destination. Positions are continuously updated via an architecture optimized to minimize battery consumption.

payments.title: Multi-Provider Payments
payments.content: Tchee supports 3 payment methods adapted to the African market: cash payment for unbanked users, credit card via Stripe for international payments, and Mobile Money (Orange Money) which represents the most popular payment method in the region. The system manages the complete transaction lifecycle with webhooks and automatic reconciliation.

dashboard.title: Financial Dashboard
dashboard.content: Drivers access a comprehensive financial dashboard displaying their real-time earnings, trip history, deducted commissions, and available balance. Detailed statistics allow performance analysis over different periods.

notifications.title: Push Notifications
notifications.content: The cross-platform push notification system uses Firebase Cloud Messaging for distribution and Notifee for local display. Passengers are notified at each step: driver assigned, imminent arrival, trip completed. Drivers receive new ride requests in real-time.

admin.title: Administration
admin.content: A web administration dashboard allows managing the entire platform: driver document validation, user management, rate configuration (price/km, price/minute, peak hour surcharges), trip monitoring, and driver payment processing.

cicd.title: CI/CD
cicd.content: Automated deployment pipeline via GitHub Actions. Each push triggers tests, build, and deployment to stores (iOS/Android) and production server. Staging and production environments are isolated with automatic rollback in case of error.

stores.title: App Store & Play Store
stores.content: Application published on the App Store (iOS) and Google Play Store (Android). Metadata, screenshots, and localized descriptions management. Apple and Google review process respected with OTA (Over-The-Air) updates via Expo Updates for minor fixes without going through the stores.

technical.title: Technical Architecture
technical.content: The mobile application is developed in React Native with Expo SDK 54, enabling deployment on iOS and Android from a single codebase. The backend uses React Router v7 in fullstack mode with MySQL database and Prisma ORM. Authentication relies on JWT with secure refresh tokens.

about.name: Eden Wisniewski
about.bio: Passionate about web and mobile development for over 6 years, I create custom digital solutions that combine performance, design and user experience.
about.experience: From innovative startups to large-scale e-commerce projects, I support my clients from design to production. My expertise covers frontend, backend, mobile and DevOps.
